info.game_comments: The IBM Challenge, continuation of game 1.

(1, 1).clue: An etude is a composition that explores a technical musical problem; the name is French for this

(2, 1).clue: Some hedgehogs enter periods of torpor; the Western European species spends the winter in this dormant condition

(3, 1).clue: It's just a bloody nose! You don't have this hereditary disorder once endemic to European royalty

(4, 1).clue: Rembrandt's biblical scene "Storm on the Sea of" this was stolen from a Boston museum in 1990

(5, 1).clue: With much "gravity", this young fellow of Trinity became the Lucasian Professor of Mathematics in 1669

(6, 1).clue: A Dana Carvey character on "Saturday Night Live"; isn't that special...

(1, 2).clue: Heitor Villa-Lobos dedicated his "12 Etudes" for this instrument to Andres Segovia

(2, 2).clue: There are about 50 species of the hedgehog type of this plant, so named for its spiny fruit

(3, 2).clue: You just need a nap! You don't have this sleep disorder that can make sufferers nod off while standing up

(4, 2).clue: A Goya stolen (but recovered) in 2006 belonged to a museum in this city (Ohio, not Spain)

(5, 2).clue: In 1626 it was "Paradise Lost" when he was "rusticated" (temporarily expelled) from Christ's College

(6, 2).clue: To bring back someone to his original function or position

(1, 3).clue: Paganini's "24 Capricci" set the standard for etudes for this instrument

(2, 3).clue: "The Hedgehog and the Fox" is an essay on this Russian count's view of history

(3, 3).clue: You just need a little more sun! You don't have this hereditary lack of pigment

(4, 3).clue: The ancient "Lion of Nimrud" went missing from this city's National Museum in 2003 (along with a lot of other stuff)

(5, 3).clue: In 1546 this king founded Trinity College, the largest of Cambridge's colleges

(6, 3).clue: A can opener with a triangular pointed end

(1, 4).clue: Music fans wax rhapsodic about this Hungarian's "Transcendental Etudes"

(2, 4).clue: Hedgehogs are covered with quills or spines, which are hollow hairs made stiff by this protein

(3, 4).clue: You're just a little stiff! You don't have this painful mosquito-borne joint illness with a Swahili name

(4, 4).clue: In May 2010 5 paintings worth $125 million by Braque, Matisse & 3 others left Paris' Museum of this art period

(5, 4).clue: The chapels at Pembroke & Emmanuel Colleges were designed by this architect

(6, 4).clue: It can mean to develop gradually in the mind or to carry during pregnancy

(1, 5).clue: From 1911 to 1917, this romantic Russian composed "Etudes-tableaux for Piano"

(2, 5).clue: A recent bestseller by Muriel Barbery is called this "of the Hedgehog"

(3, 5).clue: It's just acne! You don't have this skin infection also known as Hansen's disease

(4, 5).clue: A Titian portrait of this Spanish king was stolen at gunpoint from an Argentine museum in 1987

(5, 5).clue: This "Narnia" author went from teaching at Magdalen College, Oxford to teaching at Magdalene College, Cambridge

(0, 0).clue: Its largest airport is named for a World War II hero; its second largest, for a World War II battle
